greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (n >= 0, 0 <= k <= n) giving number of solutions to the n-box stacking problem in which exactly k boxes are used in the stack.
comment: Given n+1 boxes labeled 0..n, such that box i weighs i grams and can support a total weight of i grams, T(n,k) = number of ways to form a stack of boxes such that no box is squashed.
link: N. J. A. Sloane and J. A. Sellers, On non-squashing partitions, Discrete Math., 294 (2005), 259-274.
xref: Row sums give A089055. Columns give A000217, A005744, A089240.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 11 2003
